title: Replace “I love you” with “I like you” and add rose-petal intro Valentine prompt (Yes/No with evasive No)

requirements.text: Replace every instance of the phrase “I love you” with “I like you” across all user-facing copy on the site (including hero copy and rotating one-liners).

quotes: when remove everywhere u have written i love you instead use i like you

acceptanceCriteria: The hero paragraph in App content no longer contains “I love you” and uses “I like you” instead.
The rotating one-liners list no longer contains “I love you” and uses “I like you” instead.
A search across the frontend source for the exact string “I love you” returns no user-facing occurrences (case-sensitive match).

requirements.text: Add an intro overlay screen that appears before the existing Valentine wishing page content, showing a full-screen rose petal animation and the question text “Will you be my Valentine?” with two options: “Yes” and “No”. Clicking “Yes” must proceed to the existing wishing page content.

quotes: in the starting of before the wishing page i want you to add a pop up page of rose petals all over the screen and a question will you be my valentine's with two option yes or no for yes u bring him to the wishing page

acceptanceCriteria: On initial load, the intro overlay is shown instead of the wishing page content.
The intro overlay includes a full-screen rose petal animation (petals visible across the screen).
The intro overlay displays the exact question text: “Will you be my Valentine?”
There are two visible buttons labeled “Yes” and “No”.
Clicking “Yes” dismisses the intro overlay and reveals the existing wishing page content.

requirements.text: Make the intro overlay “No” button playfully evade interaction: when the user tries to click/tap it, it moves away so it cannot be clicked, while remaining responsive and accessible (including reduced-motion support).

quotes: for no make it playful such that he is not able to click the no button whenever he tries it runs away

acceptanceCriteria: Attempting to click/tap the “No” button causes it to reposition away from the pointer/finger before the click is registered, preventing a successful “No” click.
The evasive behavior stays within the viewport (button never becomes unreachable off-screen).
When `prefers-reduced-motion: reduce` is enabled, the rose petal animation and the evasive motion are disabled or significantly reduced, and the UI remains usable.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
Do not serve images from the backend; any static visuals must be front-end assets or purely CSS/emoji-based.
Keep all user-facing text in English.
nonGoals: No backend changes (Motoko actor can remain empty).
No new authentication or Internet Identity changes.
No requirement to persist the intro choice across page reloads unless explicitly added later.
